item.title: security: How Microsoft builds privacy and security to work hand-in-hand
item.description:
The article describes how Microsoft aligns privacy and security initiatives, using advanced tools and adherence to global compliance standards to protect customer data and foster trust.

item.title: ai: Announcing Azure Language in Foundry Tools for deterministic, privacy-first agents
item.description:
Microsoft announced the integration of Azure Language into Foundry Tools to support building enterprise-grade agents that emphasize deterministic behavior and stronger privacy protections. The update is positioned to help teams create predictable, secure agentic applications with tighter integration across their AI stack.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Foundry Local Android support
item.description:
Foundry Local is entering Private Preview for Android, adding to existing Windows and Mac support to enable advanced on-device AI for smartphones, tablets, and IoT devices; the release also integrates Whisper models for privacy-preserving speech and audio processing.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Foundry Local updates
item.description:
Foundry Local is in public preview and now supports the Whisper model and enhanced on-device AI for smartphones, tablets, and IoT devices, enabling privacy-preserving speech and audio processing and featuring a redesigned Foundry for improved local deployment.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: â€‹â€‹Whisper Leak: A novel side-channel attack on remote language models
item.description:
Microsoft disclosed a new side-channel attack called “Whisper Leak” that enables attackers to infer conversation topics from interactions with remote language models even when communications are encrypted. The finding was published on the Microsoft Security Blog.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog
